Internal: Configuring development environment

12 months ago

Before following these instructions please consider whether you need the full SATurn development environment configured. For example you can create Python extensions without needing the full environment installed

Windows

The full SATurn development environment is fairly complicated to install from scratch which is why we provide the package SaturnDeveloper.exe which includes an almost complete environment which you can use to make changes to SATurn and build deployment packages to give to people

  1. Download SATurnDeveloper.exe and install to a location you have write access to
  2. Configure environment variables
    File->Explorer->Right Click (This PC)->Advanced System Settings->EnvironmentVariables
    1. Add Haxe & Neko to PATH

      $SATURN\HaxeToolkit\haxe
      $SATURN\HaxeToolkit\neko

    2. Create NEKO_INSTPATH environment variable

      NEKO_INSTPATH => C:\HaxeToolkit\neko

    3. Create NEKOPATH environment variable

      NEKOPATH C:\HaxeToolkit\neko

  3. Install IntelliJ

    developer_tools/ideaIC-2017.3.4.exe

  4. Add the Haxe plugin to IntelliJ

    File->Settings->Plugin->Browse Repositories
    Install the Haxe plugin

  5. Open the SATurn project in IntelliJ

    File->Open
    Navigate to the folder you extracted SATurn to

  6. Test Haxe transpile within IntelliJ

    Ctrl+F9

If you plan to build packages to distribute to people then you will also need to install the following.

  1. Install developer_tools/VisualStudioBootStrap.exe
  2. Install developer_tools/qt-unified-windows-x86-3.0.2-online.exe

    Install 5.10 for MSVC 2017 with QWebEngine and QT Creator

  3. Install developer_tools/QtInstallerFramework-win-x86.exe
